CLUE: To alternate sequences when editing film
OUTPUT: ['**Identify Pacing**: Determine the desired pace for your scene', '**Match Actions**: Start by cutting on actions that begin in one shot and end in another', '**Maintain Spatial Continuity**: Ensure that objects and characters remain logically positioned within the 3D space of the scene throughout the edits to avoid disorientation', '**Consistent Character Positioning**: Keep characters at a similar level or perspective across cuts unless there is a deliberate reason for changing the viewpoint, such as showing dominance or emphasizing isolation.', '**Establish Eye Lines**: If a character is looking at something off-screen, the next shot of that object or person they are looking for should appear within their expected line of sight based on prior shots.', '**Match Fill Lighting**: The lighting between shots must be consistent to prevent jarring transitions', '**Color Grading Consistency**: Apply similar color correction to all clips within a sequence to unify their appearance, ensuring visual consistency across cuts.', "**Use Motivated Camera Movements**: If you've used camera movements like pans or zooms, try to match these in subsequent shots for continuity unless there is an intention to transition between different perspectives.", '**Consistent Sound Bridge**: Use audio from the following shot as a bridge to smoothen cuts when visual elements are less obvious']
